feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Datasphere
feed.subtitle: SAP Datasphere Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Unable to replicate data from BW 7.5 DSO to Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a requirement to replicate a specific set of data from BW 7.5 (On-Premise) to SAP Datasphere. We have the connection to BW setup via the cloud connector but we cannot see any of the DSOs when creating a dataflow. The client does not intend to have DPA or BW Bridge.

How can we replicate the data directly to Datasphere (without migration to BW Bridge or use of DPA)? The record counts to be replicated can be in excess of 100M records

Thanks

entry.title: Cannot replicate data from table when different trigger options exist
entry.content:
Hi,

I am having error "Initial load partitioning failed due to the following error: Partitioning for object VBRP failed / Preparation steps in SLT failed. / Cannot replicate data from table ; different trigger options exist"

replicating table using new mass transfer Id.

I have looked at table IUUC_LOGTAB_ID and could see multiple entries but MTD 006 has a different INDENT values. I am trying to use MTD 009 for replication. 

 

SOLUTION : created identical mass transfer id with same  configurations. that resolved the issue.

 

thanks,

Bhat

entry.title: Comparison Between BW and Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello,

I am currently working on a project based on Datasphere.
Datasphere is one of SAP’s data solutions and is often compared to BW.
Since I have only worked with Datasphere, I am not very familiar with BW.

Therefore, I would like to understand the differences in roles and functionalities between BW and Datasphere.
BW have limitations or difficulties in connecting to external (non-SAP) systems?

What are the key reasons why customers choose BW versus Datasphere?

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Connector for REST API
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

I want to connect a third-party REST API (Eurostat) to SAP Datasphere. This should be a simple GET REST request where data is read and should be saved into a local table in Datasphere. 

The GET request in Postman is working. 
Example URI: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/api/dissemination/statistics/1.0/data/nama_10_gdp?format=JSON&time=2025 

However, in SAP Datasphere I only find the generic Odata connector. This is not working in the validation, error: 406 not accepted. Probably this is due to the fact, that it is a REST-API and no Odata endpoint... 
Cause: Invalid odata connection! Getting odata metadata failed because of (406) Not Acceptable [HTTP/1.1 406 Not Acceptable]

We tested the generic HTTP connector too. This was validated and saved successfully. The problem here is that in the API task (in the task chain) only supports POST and PUT operations, no GET operation. So, this is as well no option. 

As we researched for Datasphere and REST-APIs we found this blog article. 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/streamlining-rest-api-integrations-in-sap-datasphere-with-task-chains-and/ba-p/14169273 
Is this the only option to connect REST APIs with an additionally BTP microservice? Is there no option in the SAP standard of Datasphere?

Thanks for your help!

Best regards,
Sarah

entry.title: SAP Datasphere: Text of transitive attribute not available in Analytic Model
entry.content:
Dear SAP Datasphere experts,

I have come across an issue, which I found already in 2023... and it seems it re-occured, or the solution is perfectly hidden, so that I cannot find it 😑

I would really appreciate if someone is able to help me.

Following scenario:

1) I have one dimension "DI Material" which has attributes, e.g. the Supplier (here the key has also a text association).

2) I have two different Fact View which both have the association to the DI Material.

3) I have two different Analytic Models on top of these, but only in one of both I can activate the attribute with its text field, and in the other this information (available text) is not shown:

Missing:

We already deployed the DI Material again, the fact view and the Analytic Model but it does not change.

We even tried creating a new AM out of the fact view ... also the new AM does not show the referenced text on "Lieferant EK-Infosatz".

What can be the root cause here? Why does it not work like expected, and how to solve it?

Thanks, Martin

entry.title: Datasphere Screen size
entry.content:
Is there a way to reduce the top size of the DataSphere screens.

The logo's and main taskbar take up to the half of a smaller portable screen. Reducing this would help showing more objects, at this moment on my Notebook I can only see 3 objects lines, so a lot of scrolling.

Hiding top sections of choosing a smaller icon task bar would help?

entry.title: Partition list of views on SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi,

I was trying to perform a health check for my DSP system and wanted to ask if anyone knows of a way to extract a list of my graphical views that contain partitions, without having to open each view manually to check for them.

Additionally, I’d like to know if anyone has any general advice or a standardized procedure for performing a system health check aimed at improving performance and memory consumption.

Thanks for your attention!

Tom

entry.title: SAC - Time Dimention ID and Description: sorting and labeling
entry.content:
Hi expects,

We have configured a bar chart where we show accumulated data along different time options: Hours, Days, weeks, months and years. They want to switch along them (being selected only one by one) in order to see the different accumulated data.


Focusing in Hours (type: String) :

  • customer wants to see the members like: HH DD-MM-YYYY 
  • Originally members comes from Datasphere like: YYYY-MM-DD HH

The problem here comes with the sorting: Sorting must go ascending (obviously):

  • For YYYY-MM-DD HH format works fine: 2025-09-01 10, 2025-09-01 11, 2025-09-01 12 and so on
  • For HH DD-MM-YYYY , the sorting works like: 10 01-09-2023, 10 01-09-2024, 10 01-09-2025 and so on

The only chance I think we have is to set up the dimension in this way:

  • ID must be with YYYY-MM-DD HH format and then the sorting will work following the ID
  • Description Must be with format HH DD-MM-YYYY and theoretically

Is there any way to do this? Any suggestion? Thank you in advance!

entry.title: How to count unbooked dimension members in SAP Datasphere for coverage calculation?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working in SAP Datasphere and I need to calculate the coverage percentage of active customers each month.
Specifically, I want to:

  1. Count all customers in my base (from the customer dimension).

  2. Count all customers who had sales in a given month (from the fact table).

  3. Divide the two results to calculate the monthly coverage percentage.

The challenge is that unbooked dimension members (customers with no sales in the selected month) are not being counted, since Datasphere’s support for unbooked members seems to be limited.

Is there a recommended approach or workaround to include unbooked members (dimension members without fact data) in the calculation?
For example, any way to simulate “Show unbooked members” or force the join to consider all dimension members when building measures or analytical models?

Thanks in advance for any guidance or best practices!

entry.title: Exceptional Aggregation
entry.content:
Hi,
 
I have created Analytic Model using the Sales Order View. All is good and working.
Now I created new Calculated Measure in the Analytic Model, with Header Gross Amount. Exceptional Aggregation Type is SUM, and Exceptional Aggregation Dimensions is SalesOrder.
However in the output, this Calculated Measure still sum up from Sales Item level. Example following raw data:
 
Sales Order, Sales Item, Header Gross Amount
100000090, 10, 100
100000090, 20, 100
 
 
Output display as following:
Sales Order, Header Gross Amount
100000090, 10, 200
 
 
I would expect the Header Gross Amount to be 100, not 200.
 
Why the exceptional aggregation not working? 
 
Thank you.

entry.title: How to extend or disable password lifetime for SAP Datasphere database user?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m currently accessing SAP Datasphere data from Google BigQuery using a Datasphere database user. Everything works fine, but I’ve run into an issue with password expiration.

The database user’s password expires every 90 days, which causes my BigQuery jobs to fail until I manually:

  1. Reset the password in SAP Datasphere, and

  2. Update the connection details in BigQuery.

I tried checking in the SAP HANA Cockpit (linked to the Datasphere tenant) to modify the password lifetime parameter, but it seems I don’t have permission or the option to change it.

My questions are:

  • Is there a way for me to set or extend the password lifetime for this database user?

  • Or is this something that SAP must configure on their end for managed tenants?

Any guidance or experience from others who have faced the same issue would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

entry.title: Integration of SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere using JDBC
entry.content:
Integration Between SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere (JDBC Connection)  
 
JDBC – JAVA DATABASE CONNECTIVITY 
 
Why Recommendation for JDBC Over OData API : 
JDBC is recommended over OData when consuming large-scale records (e.g., 100,000+) because JDBC streams data directly from the database with better performance and less overhead, while OData is optimized for lightweight, paginated, service-based access. 
 
Problem statement: 3337495 - OData API returns less records than expected due paging 
Pagination limits in OData and Ariba APIs can be handled in SAP CPI using a looping process call. 
 
Goal: Connect CPI to a database used by DataSphere (JDBC) and run a simple read data from the (Analytical Model / Table /View).  
 
For the Write / Delete / Update method, the attached SAP Help Portal Link has syntax in the reference section. 
 
Prerequisites: 

  1. SAP DataSphere – Subscribed account (⚠ Trial has limited features, JDBC not supported) 
  1. SAP Integration Suite – Subscribed or Trial (JDBC actions supported) 

 

SAP DataSphere Step by Step Guide : 
 

Step 

Action / Notes 

1. Create a Space 

DataSphere → Space Management → New Space → Name it → Create. 

2. Create Table / Analytical Model 

Data Builder → In your Space → New → Table or Analytical Model → define fields & data types → Save & Publish. 
*Verify Table/Model Deployed Successfully. * 

3. Prepare / Load Data 

Load data manually for testing cases. Otherwise load CSV/import to table via Data Builder/Data Integration. 

4. Note Schema & Object Names 

Record schema name, table name, and view names for JDBC SQL use. 
* Created space name is the SCHEMA name and Collect Table / Model name * 

5. Decide Where to Create DB User 

If HANA Cloud → use HANA Cockpit/DB Explorer. If on-prem DB → use DB admin tools or contact DB Admin. 
* We are using the HANA cloud system for practical session* 

6. Create JDBC DB User 

DB admin tool → Security/Users → New User → set username & strong password → Save. 
*Check Active status of User* 

7. Grant Privileges for the DB user 

Assign only required privileges (e.g., SELECT for read; add INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE for CRUD). Best practice: create role JDBC_ROLE and assign. 

8. Prepare JDBC Connection Details 

Gather JDBC URL (e.g.  sample URL from datasphere: z*********-abc.hana.prod-eu10.hanacloud.ondemand.com 
Format for CPI JDBC Material: 
jdbc:sap://<host>:<port>/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true 

 
SAP Integration Suite Step by Step Guide : 
 
Create a Package & Artifact 

  • In CPI → Design → Create a new package → Add an integration flow artifact. 
  • ✅ Make sure your CPI user has the required roles to create and access design-time artifacts. 
     

Go to Monitoring → JDBC Material 

  • In CPI → Monitor → Integrations and APIs → Manage Security → JDBC Material

     

     
  • → Add JDBC Data Source. → Select HANA cloud  

     

     
     
  • Provide JDBC URL in the correct format (e.g., jdbc:sap://<hana-host>:443/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true). 

     

     
  • Enter DB username and password (use the dedicated JDBC user created earlier in DataSphere). 

     

     
  • Save and deploy the JDBC material. 
    •  

    Apply JDBC Material in iFlow

    • In your integration flow, configure the JDBC receiver adapter → select the JDBC data source created.
    • Use SQL queries (SELECT) in the Processing tab or provide XML query body. Here, I’m using SQL SELECT * to fetch all records from the table.

     


    Step 1: Timer Start
     In this iFlow, the Start Timer is configured with a Simple Schedule → None → On Deployment, which means the integration flow automatically triggers immediately after deployment.

     


    Step 2: Content Modifier
    Use this SQL query to fetch all records with the body operation.
     SELECT * FROM "<Schema>"."<Model/TableName>"

     



    Step 3: Request Reply & JDBC Receiver Adapter
         → Use the deployed JDBC Data Source alias in the JDBC Material in the previous step and set Max records count based on your requirement.
    → JDBC Maximum Records per call:  2,147,483,647

     


    Sample data Response from JDBC Connection:

     



    References :

    CPI JDBC – XML Query in Body for CRUD Operations (Syntax Guide)
     link:
    https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/payload-and-operation

entry.title: Perform CRUD operation from SAP BTP BAS on Datasphere.

While we’ve successfully implemented the read (fetch) functionality using the architecture shown below, we’re currently facing challenges with enabling create, update, and delete operations directly on Datasphere tables.

 

 

We’d really appreciate any guidance, resources, or architectural suggestions that could help us achieve this. If anyone has experience or insights on enabling write operations with Datasphere from BAS, your support would be invaluable!

 

SAP Datasphere SAP Cloud Application Programming Model  SAP Fiori Cloud  

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Business Builder with SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m seeking clarification regarding SAP’s current stance on the Business Layer within SAP Datasphere. The eLearning content indicates that the Business Layer has been deprecated, but I haven’t found any recent updates or official guidance from SAP beyond that.
Could anyone share insights or point to any official communication from SAP regarding whether customers are still encouraged to use the Business Layer, or if the recommendation is to transition fully to unified modeling using Analytic Models?

Regards,

Manjush Jose

entry.title: Datasphere Use of Dummy Table
entry.content:
Hi to all,

is there a way to use the sys.dummy table within Datasphere.

When I try to use it in a view the I get the following error message:
"....cannot be saved because it depends on following missing objects: SYS.DUMMY","messageCode":"MISSING_DEPENDENCY"}"

 

BR Joscha
